  • Method Details

    • cachedStep

      public static ImageTransformationStep cachedStep(ReferenceType refType, ImageTransformationStep step, TransformationStepInput.Cmp cacheCmp)
      Returns an ImageTransformationStep which delegates its call to the specified ImageTransformationStep but caches its result if possible. Caching might be done with weak, soft or hard references.

      Caching is done by retaining a reference to both the input and the output of the passed ImageTransformationStep and whenever a new input is available checks if it is the same as the one cached. If the inputs are matching, then the cached result is returned.

      Warning: The returned is ImageTransformationStep is not safe to be accessed concurrently.

      Parameters:
      refType - the type of the reference used to retain both the input and the output of the cached ImageTransformationStep. For this argument ReferenceType.UserRefType is equivalent to ReferenceType.NoRefType. This argument cannot be null.
      step - the ImageTransformationStep to which calls are delegated to if the cached output is not available or out-of-date. This argument cannot be null.
      cacheCmp - the comparison which is able to tell if the specified ImageTransformationStep will yield the same output for two inputs or not. This comparison should be quick and may return false if the exact check would be too slow. That is, the comparison is expected to do little more work than comparing references. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the ImageTransformationStep which delegates its call to the specified ImageTransformationStep but caches its result if possible. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null
